Evaluate mortality variation

Source: R/fct_mort_data_reg.R
mort_data_reg.Rd

Evaluate mortality variation

mort_data_reg(type = c("sex", "age"))

Arguments

type

(chr) "sex" or "age" stratification respectively

Value

a tibble including name, stratas, 2019 and 2020 overall death by strata, and the relative variation from 2019 to 2020

Examples

mort_data_reg("sex")
#> # A tibble: 63 x 5
#>    regione    strata `2019` `2020` variation
#>    <chr>      <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 Abruzzo    m          36     55     52.8 
#>  2 Abruzzo    f          30     70    133.  
#>  3 Abruzzo    mf         66    125     89.4 
#>  4 Basilicata m          18     17     -5.56
#>  5 Basilicata f          18     17     -5.56
#>  6 Basilicata mf         36     34     -5.56
#>  7 Calabria   m           8     19    138.  
#>  8 Calabria   f          12     21     75   
#>  9 Calabria   mf         20     40    100   
#> 10 Campania   m          37     62     67.6 
#> # … with 53 more rows
mort_data_reg("age")
#> # A tibble: 63 x 5
#>    regione    strata `2019` `2020` variation
#>    <chr>      <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 Abruzzo    65-74       7     10      42.9
#>  2 Abruzzo    75-84      17     31      82.4
#>  3 Abruzzo    85+        34     73     115. 
#>  4 Basilicata 65-74       3      3       0  
#>  5 Basilicata 75-84       9     10      11.1
#>  6 Basilicata 85+        19     21      10.5
#>  7 Calabria   65-74       1      3     200  
#>  8 Calabria   75-84       5     13     160  
#>  9 Calabria   85+        12     24     100  
#> 10 Campania   65-74      11     17      54.6
#> # … with 53 more rows
